intro: Heinekenia maculata, commonly known as the spotted heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are often spotted or streaked with white or pale green markings. It produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. Heinekenia maculata is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
